com.byteslooser.filters.parser
Interface IFilterTextParser

All Known Implementing Classes:
FilterTextParser, REFilterTextParser
public interface IFilterTextParser

Interface defining the requirements on text parsing for filter expressions.

The assumption is the existence of multiple variables, where the filter can define any associated condition. The type of each variable is known, and the interface provides means to define associated parsers and comparators, which should improve the 'intelligence' of the parser.

This interface is influenced by the generic RowFilter.Entry class, used by default to filter tables from Java 6 on. As such, each variable has associated a 'position', which can be used to request the value of the variable to a RowFilter.Entry (in this class, the notation calls it 'index')

Author:
Luis M Pena - byteslooser@gmail.com

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

parseText

RowFilter parseText(String expression,
                    int defaultFilterPosition)
                    throws FilterTextParsingException

Parses the text, using the given default identifier.

If the parsed expression includes conditions that specify no identifier, the default identifier is used.

Default identifier can be NO_FILTER_POSITION, if the expression must provide them specifically

A filter supporting the interface RowFilter receives an instance of type RowFilter.Entry that can enquiry to obtain the value at a specified index; the filter position is that given index, and corresponds, in the case of a table, to the column to which this editor is associated.

Throws:
FilterTextParsingException

setIdentifiers

void setIdentifiers(List<IdentifierInfo> validIdentifiers)
Defines the identifiers, and the types and indexes associated to them

setIgnoreCase

Ignores case on the conditions associated to variables with String type
